column2: sissy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
carol, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Taken since I had a complete historectomy 20 years ago. Now 62 taking half tablet everyday. Not sure when I need to stop. It is a great drug for woman without ovaries and uterus.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My Dr gave me this to help increase my libido. I'm almost 57 and had to have a complete hysterectomy when I was 29. I took Premarin for years and came off of it when all the bad reports started coming out about it. Initially this med helped however in the last week I have developed a vaginal discharge, extremely itchy and it has a smell to it. Told my husband that we couldn't do anything, I don't want him to get it if it is a yeast infection. Haven't had a problem like this in literally years!! Also I have become extremely moody, almost angry at everything. That is not me!! Have also developed sinus problems that I do not normally have and some acne on my chin. Have become very tired feeling in the last couple of weeks, no energy at all. Really disappointed in this med!! I will be coming off this medication and trying to find something natural to take.

column2: Dottie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Never had bone and joint problems, felt good all the time, was in good mood all the time. Do they still make this drug?

column2: Tan, IL, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Had a full hysto at 36 and am now 38. I love this med and how it makes me feel but have only been taken it "some times" for fear of long term usage. Ya know...breat cancer, heart disease, beard, mustache, penis growth...lol...and whatever else they can come up with. I personally want to say "thanks ladies" for all your posts. I feel more confident and will take my meds on the regular.

column2: 1success, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Estratest approximately 10 years ago for SLE( Systemic Lupus), after reading that it could promote remission(in some instances) of the disease. After about three months, I did in fact go into remission. Now, ten years later, the disease has returned with a vengeance. I have shown some improvement on Plaqunil, but not enough to experience any quality of life. Again, I will request Estratest or its generic from my gyn and hope for the same results.

column2: lindy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: It helped my depression, I still had a sex drive which I don't have without it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
Brenda S, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This HRT was wonderful until I re-filled it. It was replaced by another generic by a different manufacturing co.  I feel like I am not taking anything and am having withdrawals.  When I called The presc co, they told me it was the same only a different manuf.  They gave the number to me for the manuf co.  I called them, left a message on a voice mail, have not heard from them.  What are we supposed to do?I am miserable!

column2: katie9396, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Full Hyst. at age 21 due to cervical cancer/endo and severe cyst.  I have tried other drugs due to the cost of this in the first few years and had horrible experience, on estratest I have great sex drive and few hot flashes I am now 34 and take "EST Estrogenmtest" still available and only 9$ rx at walmart.

column2: mommysteph, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've been on this med for about a year. I am 25 years old and had a total hysterectomy in 2008. After trying other drugs, this one was the most effective. However, I have gained about 20lbs of which I CANNOT GET RID OF. I also have experienced more aggresstive behavior and just seem to have less patience than before...I react with anger in an instant and then wonder where it came from. I hate to stop taking it because it does work great for getting rid of the hot flashes, night sweats, etc. but I just don't think the side effects are worth it anymore...

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken estratest for over 8 years because of a complete hysterctomy. it worked great. now they took it off of the market and I am miserable. the generic brands do not work at all!! i am so upset and dont know what to do. I am only 44 years old and dont want to go through this. I am too young!!!

column2: Sharon, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 48 yrs old and in perimenopause. Dr put me on estratest and prometrium 100 mg. The first week I was tired and moody, those side have now gone and I feel better. More alert, not as tired at the end of the day and sleep is now wonderful.

column2: sag1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The second night of taking this med, I was extremely restless, weird dreams, couldn't relax, my thoughts were all over the place.  The third night was the same except worst.  I felt find during the day, had more energy but I discontinued the meds because of the nighttime madness.

column2: moonspirit, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My libido increased way too much so I cut down to 1/2 pill a day. I also noticed that I felt more "aggressive" and angry. The one thing it did for me was to relieve hot flashes very well, esp when used in combo w/Vivelle dot patch.  However, my depression/moods worsened, have had bad headaches and worst of all, gained 15 lbs in one month and was still going up so I decided to stop and try something else.

column2: tami6266, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Had a hysterectomy in 05,started estratest before I was even released from hospital. Worked great ever since the beginning,now it isn't on the market. My dr changed me to estradiol, it is almost the same. I do have the night sweats now & some moodiness. I tried the vivelle dot patch for a couple of months but it didn't work at all & when dr increased the patch it made me vomit uncontrollably. So, we had to go to estradiol. Wouldn't give up this med for any reason, it has helped me a lot.

column2: Kym, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: It has worked for me, for years! All otherHRO's worked with everything except the night sweats. Now the producer of Estratest has ended it's production, and another Co. has taken over. It is now too expensive for me to afford. I would love to know of a very similar  replacement!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I took Estrates HS for 30+ years after a complete hysterectomy & removal of both ovaries.  It was no longer available, so my physician took me off any hrt.  I have had hot flashes and some mood swings.  I have also had 3 breast lumps removed ... non cancerous.

column2: flashgordon, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've been on estratest since 1993 I gained a lot of weight and it's impossible to get off. I was not heavy before.

column2: dunerd, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took estratest for 15 years (along with Premarin .3) until this past year when they switched me to Fem HRT.  After nearly 6 months, I was profoundly depressed, could not sleep, had gained weight and was miserable.  Found a generic replacement for estratest(EEMT HS), and have been on it for one month.  I have lost the weight, I'm sleeping again and am back to my normal, upbeat self.  I am blown away by how powerfully I was affected by the other drug, and how big of a change this has made in my life. I highly recommend the EEMT for those who are looking for a replacement to estratest.

column2: Poodlegal, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've used Estratest for 18(?) years.  I had very bad (suicidal) depression and found immediate relief.  I am now 70 yrs old and am unable to find it.  I've tried the generic and it does not work.  I'm slowly getting back all my "symptoms".  My skin is great, my "insides" work great and sex is great and I regularly get "carded" for 55 discount!  I want my Estratest back!  I will keep looking for a solution to this ridiculous problem.

column2: Dr. Mika, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: For those of you who are having trouble getting Estratest, it is made now under the name of COVARYX and produced by Centrix Pharmaceuticals. You can go to www.centrixpharmaceuticals.com and get a $10 rebate coupon for this medication. It has the same exact medication as Estratest. I have been a nurse for 25 years and I study these things. Covaryx works as well as Estratest because it is the same medicine. Just a different company making it.. Trust me..

column2: Dr. Mika, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: For those of you who are having trouble getting Estratest, it is made now under the name of COVARYX and produced by Centrix Pharmaceuticals. You can go to www.centrixpharmaceuticals.com and get a $10 rebate coupon for this medication.

column2: Ladeee, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: After an early hysterectomy at 28, I've tried many HRT's.  This by far the best.  Would fight to keep it!  Without, it's only half a life ... in every way, physically, mentally and emotionally.  Out of the fog, back to me.  Thank you.

column2: riley, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Loving Life, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on Estratest for 10+ years and in my opinion all the benefits outweigh any risk! I was depressed at 42. Doctors put me on anti-depressants, etc. but they did not work. Then my doctor put me on hormone therapy and all my severe symptoms went away. I have never suffered from hot flashes or any typical "change of life" difficulties. At 65 years of age I love sex and dryness is not a problem! Now what do I do? Is there any other drug out there that might work?

column2: Catrina555, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on Estratest(and now on the generic version EEMT) for 12 years and in my opinion all the benefits outweigh any risk! My mother became depressed at 43, same as me. Doctors put her on anti-depressants, etc. She lived another 18 years of misery. My doctor put me on hormone therapy and all my severe symptoms went away. I have never suffered from hot flashes or any typical "change of life" difficulties. At 55 years of age I love sex and dryness is not a problem! Go hormone therapy!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
sharon, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this med for over 10 years. it is my lifeline. i have switched to generic and it seems to work fine for me. i do realize that without this treatment, i would not be able to function in the workplace. before i had experienced forgetfulness and lack of ability to focus, not to mention depression. that little touch of testosterone makes a huge difference

column2: myuse, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for over 25 years.  It worked!  Had had vaaginal dryness, mood swings, and loss of libido after a total hysterectomy.  My pharmastist changed my medication to Covaryx which does not clear my symptoms.  Is there another more effective alternative?

column2: KARENJAYNES, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This has been my mainstay  for 30 years now.  It helps with all menopausal symptoms and with libido and orgasm.  Have been informed it is no longer being offered and am at my wits end.  Generics ARE NOT EFFECTIVE.  I have remained physically healthy and younger looking than my age.  I simply DO NOT KNOW WHAT I AM GOING TO DO NOW.  HELP!!!!!!!!!

column2: Malee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am very satisfied with this treatment. No more hot flashes or sweating and my libido is normal.  No break through bleeding, or weight gain.  All my checkups have been normal.  It is the perfect med for me. And this med is still available as a generic. Only the brand name is not being made anymore.  Don't let anyone convince you otherwise, check it out.

column2: CM estratest user, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was on Estratest for 5 years, and on Cenestin before.However they have pulled the name brand and I have been on the generic for several months now. The generics do not work, and I have had severe side effects. I am going off the generic today, per my doctor's instruction.I never knew there was a problem with Estratest,and the FDA.The drug store just said they changed me to a generic equivalent per my insurance company. I want to alert other users of my severe reactions, heart palpitrations, dizziness, bladder problems, sleep disorder now. Doctors and drug companies should alert patients to the problems

column2: SharBare, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Complete relief of night sweats, so better sleep. I have gained about 7 pounds in one and half months. I also have been having 3-4 bowel movements per day, very unusual for me.  Will be seeing gyn this week.

column2: Sylvia, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Was given Estratest immediately after complete hysterectomy at age 47.  Never experienced any of the menopause systems until stopped taking it for 7 days (other doctors, nurses negative comments on use).  After only 7 days starting having severe night sweats; after 22 days husband INSISTED I "get medicine now".  After 5 days was fine again. All was great until May "09 found out my insurance will no longer cover this medicine and no longer available.  Starting taking Premarin and IT IS NOT as good. In just 2 weeks started having mild hot flashes, some night sweats and weird mood swings.  After 4 months I am quite miserable and very unhappy.  Guess I get to start the "drug taking experiment" to see what will come close to previous experience.  Why do they mess with a good thing?  Probably a group of men that don't have a clue (and don't care) about the internal workings of the female body made this decision.

column2: dsa4happiness, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Estratest for 13 years and love it. I had a total hysterectomy at the age of 37. My doctor said that there is no problem in taking this drug for the rest of my life. However, recently I went to renew my prescription and was given "Estrogen-Methyltestos D.S." I was not informed that there would be a change, but am learning from these comments that Estratest is no longer being made. With the cost only being $10 with my insurance, I assume it must be generic. I've only been on the new medicine for a week, but it seems to be working comparable to the other.

column2: lucien111, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on Estratest for 20 years.  I remain extremely youthful in appearance,  vital, without menopausal symptoms.  I was just informed it has been taken off the market and I am devastated.  Have tried generics which do not work.

column2: ph76115@yahoo.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug for 14 years after an emergency hyst. I was allergic to all the other HRT replacements. I have had no trouble with this drug what so ever and felt great!  I was informed they are not making this drug anymore.  I tried the generic EEMT.  I have had a major allergic reaction to the EEMT.  They are not the same!!

column2: Judy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: IT IS STILL AVAILABLE - SORT OF!!  Like everyone else taking this med, I was shocked when just today Medco notifies my doctor's office that Estratest HS is no longer available.  Not satisfied with second/third hand information, I called Medco and spoke with a pharmacist - who was full of information!  (1)  ESTRATEST (full strength) is still being produced by Solvay.  (2)  MOST IMPORTANT:  Now available is "EEMT HS" (esterified estrogens;methyltestosterone HALF STRENGTH).  This cannot yet be called a "generic," but the pharmacist advised it has the identical components of ESTRATEST HS except for the coating.  This was also verfied by a Kroger pharmacist.  And, a pharmacy assistant showed me the containers of both full and half-strength - ON THE SHELF!  A Medco rep, for all the good they were today, did advise that it is covered by insurance.GOOD LUCK!!

column2: steelegal@gmail.com, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug for 16 years and love it.  I went off for a couple of years due to a "doomsayer nurse practicioner".  During that 2 years I aged and felt terrible.  I'm back on estratest but my insurance won't pay for it as it is now FDA approved.  What's the matter with the FDA?  Maybe they need more women of menapause age on the committee.  If it's true that they are not making it anymore it's probably due to the lack of FDA approval.  This is a travesty!  Please tell me it's not true.

column2: buffy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Ive taken this drug since 2002, a miracle drug in short.  And yes the manufacturer is no longer making the wonder drug.  There are no FDA approved replacement for it either.  My doctor has started me on premarin and I feel like I've aged 10 yrs and a week.  There's got to be something women can take as an alternative, please HELP!!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug due to a complete hysterectomy for 18 years.  I was recently notified that the drug company is no longer making this drug and that there is no equivalent! Is this true?

column2: Sha-sha, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken this medication for 4 1/2 months. It relieved my night sweats, moodiness, etc.  But my beautician noticed that my hair started to thin and the edges showed the greatest loss.  I did notice weight gain as well. My Dr. is changing my prescription to Premarin.

column2: Great at 55, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I had a complete hysterectomy at 37.  I tried several forms of HRT and nothing worked.  I seemed to be resistant.  I then started Estratest used with Vivelle Dot.  They work for me.  I am now 55 and worry a bit about having taken HRT for so long, but I feel great, have energy and great quality of life.  I have regular check ups and keep a close eye on side effects.

column2: tbrown, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was on Prempro when I read about Estratest in Readers Digest. Asked Dr about it, started taking it, and loved it,  although after a time, the increased metabolism waned some.  It is still my drug of choice because I have never had a hot flash, night sweat, & other.  My feelings of "doom" went away with this treatment.  I had total removal of all female organs and feel this helps keep me "human".

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: After 20 years of HRT, this is the 1st time I've felt like a full blooded woman! Sex drive is stupendous, night sweats minimal and overall "mood" balanced out.

column2: 35-44 Female  (Patient)
coop, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I felt this was a miracle drug at first. After several months of use I developed heart palipatations and shortness of breath. I discontinued use and have not been bothered with the palipataions since.I was on a very mild dose and took only half a tablet. When taking this drug, be sure to have regular checkups and report any odd symptoms.

column2: Sabrina, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I went into early menopause as a result of my total hystorectomy after many, many years of endometrial problems + cysts, etc.  I am an athlete and along w/ Vivelle Dot patches take this every other day, half dose.  It helps me with the Testostrone loss that is not talked about enough! I tried several pills, patches and combos of things and these 2 treatments have been excellent!

column2: cjty06@comcast.net, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was put on this after a complete hysteretomy at 43. I was suffering hot flashes and no sleep.  I feel more normal but have gained a total of 45 lbs in 4 years.

column2: kthompso, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I have been taking this Etratest for about 2 months and I can't tell you how much better I feel.  It has done much for my lobido, but I'll give it some more time.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
JK, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Increased sex drive, no more vaginal dryness or pain during intercourse.

column2: kkjar, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Was given this medication to help with Libido. Not fased it. Made me very tired and grumpy. Don't like it.

column2: myshell103165, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had some improvement in the short time I have been on this med but, I have gained about eight pounds in less than amonth of use!  I had a complete hysterectomy when I was 27 and I am now 42.  They put me on hormones after my hysterectomy and I gained alot of weight years ago also.  I had never been heavy at all in life even after having kids!  Almost three years ago I had a gastric bypass because of the excessive weight gain and had lost all my unwanted weight.  Now that I'm on hormones again and gaining some weight already I don't now if its worth it and it scares me to be on the hormones!!

column2: Frustrated, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 38 , and I had a hysterestomy at the age of 31, due to my body being tormented with endometrial cancer, and my body went through a surgical menapause.  My body has been rejecting the menapausal systems for some time now.  I was taking hormone shots prior to this medication, and nothing seems to work.  I continue to have hot flashes, mood swings, and very bad headaches.

column2: aitkin44@aol.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This medicine really worked for me.  Unfortunately my doctor cancelled my prescription and put me on Covaryx which is NOT working for me.

column2: molly, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have started a period.  I will report this but so far it seems normal.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
